bio:
Sono fondamentalmente un dev appasionato.
Sono socio fondatore di 4Solid, una società che cerca di sviluppare codice divertendosi e ovviamente, commettendo errori.
Mi piace restare fuori dalla mia Confort-Zone in modo da avere continuamente stimoli nel proseguire questo lavoro ... o passione.
Quando non scrivo codice amo perdermi fra le montagne, soprattutto se sono isolate e imbiancate. Amo tracciare linee con i miei sci dove ancora non è passato nessuno.
tagLine: Miracles sometimes occur, but one has to work terribly for them (C.Weizamann)

sessions.name: Embracing Failure

bio:
Appassionato di tutto ciò che è tecnologico e programmatore da 15 anni. 
Inizia in ambito Java enterprise per approdare al mondo .NET già dalla versione 1.1 del framework.
Lavora come freelance per varie aziende tra abruzzo e lazio soprattutto in ambito web ma ha una passione smodata per il mondo mobile, soprattutto in ambito smartphone.
Fondatore della community Dotnet Abruzzo  in cui veste i panni di speaker ed organizzatore di eventi.
MVP dal 2016 nella categoria Windows Development

sessions.name: Realtà aumentata ed azure, un binomio imbattibile

bio: University Master Degree in Statistics I worked as Application and System Engineer in the International SW Development Lab of IBM in Italy. I was Professor of Relational Database Design at the University La Sapienza of Rome. I am founder and co-owner of Information Design, an IT Consulting Company. I worked as temporary manager (IT and Finance) in the Daimler (Mercedes) Outsourcing Company; I took part in international task forces for defining valuation and transfer strategies of all the assets of big data centers (IBM Mainframes). I have been working in International Software Projects and I have a Big experience in Databases and Data/System Integration. I am a Google Expert Cloud  and I got several certifications: AWS Solutions Architect Associate GOOGLE CLOUD Associate Engineer GOOGLE CLOUD Professional Data Engineer GOOGLE CLOUD Professional Cloud Architect ORACLE Database Administrator Neo4j Certification. I am passionate about Machine Learning and Big Data. Since 2011, I have been Google Developer Group GDG ROMA Founder and Leader. I have always supervised the technical aspects of all activities. We organize any kind of events, from the big ones (600 people) to Labs and long-term training programs. I like to enlist special kinds of events: Several Treasure Hunts with Android apps A GDG rail car Lab traveling to Droidcon A Cloud event for about 350 people in the Mercedes Benz Congress Center with the chance to take a ride with fast and powerful Mercedes cars An I/O extended with kids playing tech in the garden and the training activities: Android Web mobile Development ML Angular Cloud DialogFlow/Action on Google. I organize very active sessions, without long boring lectures. With our help, many people managed to improve their professional life, to get a better job, and to gain more self-confidence and motivation. I am really proud of it and I am grateful to Google for giving me this opportunity.
tagLine: IT Manager Information Design - Google Developer Expert Cloud - AWS e GCP Cloud Certified - Leader Google Developer Group Roma

sessions.name: Workshop: Serverless: Azure WITH the rest of the world

bio:
Antonio Liccardi is a book author, a consultant at Blexin s.r.l., and a specialized trainer on mobile development and application lifecycle management. Thanks to his love for sharing, he co-founded “DotNetCampania” (an Italian .NET community), with which he helps others to improve their knowledge about .NET Ecosystem and more in general about coding.
Antonio is a frequent speaker at local and Italian conferences, and he has been awarded by Microsoft as MVP for Visual Studio Developer Technologies since 2015. 
You can find him on Twitter as @turibbio

Dal 2011 collabora con SolidQ, dove si occupa principalmente di progettazione, implementazione ed ottimizzazione architetturale, monitoring, performance tuning di soluzioni basate su SQL Server, formazione.  Microsoft Certified Trainer dal 2000 e SQL Server MVP dal 2014, è anche co-leader del PASS Global Italian Virtual Chapter, lo user group "virtuale" in lingua italiana dedicato a SQL Server.

Quotidianamente aiuta i suoi clienti sin dalla fase di modellazione dei processi di business, accompagnandoli attraverso lo sviluppo fino ad arrivare al deployment, per il quale si è particolarmente specializzato sull’adozione di Azure.
Quando non è impegnato a stare al computer, ama leggere fumetti, giocare di ruolo e fare sport

bio:
Agile coach - DevOps \ ALM practitioner. I’m responsible to deliver and manage application development support contracts in Microsoft Italia subsidiary.

I'm enthusiastic and passionate in technologies and emerging trends about Application Lifecycle processes and tools, Quality Driven Development, Cloud architectures, Microservices Approach.

Constantly focused on how DevOps discusses today's successful business strategies evolution around continuous improvement practices, and how implementing a DevOps environment can achieve this goal. Particularly involved on how cultural changes associated with implementing DevOps are discussed, including challenges in this area.

I can define my strenght points in deep strategic thinking and strong leadership attitude. Excellent communication and presentational skills.

He has got Master Architect via Open Group Certification . Fausto during his career always worked in strategic and highly complex programs and opportunities in different roles such as Enterprise Architect, Chief Technologist, Solution Executive and Chief Architect covering a critical success factor role as key team member . Fausto is based in Rome, Italy

bio:
DevOps architect con 10 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo software, Federico progetta quotidianamente sistemi resilienti ed ultrascalabili.
Esperto conoscitore di Scrum, applica olisticamente principi agili al fine di promuovere la comunicazione e migliorare la produttività del team.
Federico è un convinto sostenitore dell’importanza della qualità dello sviluppo software e della trasparenza all’interno del team al fine di individuare costantemente margini di miglioramento e tradurli in risultati tangibili.

sessions.name: Deconstructing Kubernetes using AKS

bio: Giancarlo lavora per Avanade Italy nell’ Italy Delivery Center a Cagliari. In qualità di Technical Lead ha il compito di supervisionare le attività di sviluppo, stimare e definire le attività tecniche necessarie per portare avanti i progetti in cui è coinvolto. Essendo il suo team parte della practice CRM, la piattaforma Microsoft Dynamics è il suo pane quotidiano. Giancarlo partecipa abitualmente in veste di speaker a numerose conferenze sul territorio nazionale parlando principalmente di tecnologie collegate alla Windows Platform e al mondo del Cloud. E’ Lead e fondatore di Italian Developer Connection, uno user group dedicato alle tecnologie Microsoft attivo nel sud Italia. Dal 2015 al 2018 è stato Microsoft MVP per la categoria Windows Development ed è certificato MCSE Cloud Platform & Infrastructure.

bio:
Lavoro in Engineering come Solution Architect su differenti tipologie di progetti, da architetture cloud a complessi sistemi enterprise on-premise.

bio:
Increasing partners ROI on cloud investments with the right architecture is one my objectives as a Cloud Solution Architect working for Microsoft. Improving people’s public speaking skills is one of my personal goals.
I'm specialized in Cloud Application Development, both Azure and Office 365, Windows and cross-platform applications, Visual Studio, ALM and DevOps, and I like to talk with people and communities about technology, food, and funny things.
I'm a speaker, a trainer, and a public speaking coach. I've helped many students, devs, other professionals and many colleagues, improving their stage presence, to deliver exceptional presentations.
I work for Microsoft Western Europe, in the One Commercial Partner SI Alps division, helping partners (System Integrators), developers, communities, and customers in Italy, Austria and Switzerland, supporting software development on Microsoft and OSS technologies.
I've managed teams of more than twenty people, and now I enjoy when I can lead virtual teams to drive specific results.
I'm a Microsoft Certified Trainer since 2000 and a former Microsoft MVP for ALM, DevOps, and Virtual Machines.
I write articles for Italian IT magazines and I speak at conferences in Italy and Europe, and I'm currently trying to finish my first book.

Specialties: Cloud Architectures, Training, Software Development, Problem Solving, Team Development, Coaching
tagLine: Normal People Bore Me! Cloud Wizard @ Microsoft, Solutions Architect, Speaker, Mentor, Would-Be Book Author. Here & Now.

He develops Mobile and Embedded Application for retail and enterprise Sector. He is also involved in developing Windows Phone and Windows 10 application for 3rd party company. 
He is a Trainer and a Speaker in the main technical conference.
He is part of the staff of DotNetToscana a community focused on Microsoft technologies.
In 2013 Microsoft recognize him the title of Microsoft MVP .
Since May 2014 he has been an Intel Software Innovator for Realsense and IoT technologies.
In 2015 Intel has recognized him the title of Intel Black Belt Software Developer.
In 2017 he joined Projest SPA as Enterprise IT Manager

bio:
I’m an accomplished, result driven management professional with 20 years of experience in both IT and business functions.
Proven history of managing complex IT operations and strategy for the development and delivery of high technological product and services.
I’m highly skilled in proposal development and delivering business results by creating tailor made Cloud and IOT based solutions around the specific customer needs. My passions are to architect and build up teams of qualified professionals, redesign and streamline of software processes integrating more departments, delivering perfectly governed eco-systems. Decisional trees based on microservices plots, especially in OSS sauce, represent my greatest fun. Even if I'm historically voted to OSS / Java / Spring Platform, I learned (and I'm still learning) the wonders of the Azure platform every day.
